title: [BUG] forecaster fit/predict interface
body:
**Describe the bug**
I think the current behaviour of the forecasting API isn't very consistent. My preferred specification is described here: https://github.com/sktime/community-org/blob/main/meetups/previous_meetings/20210909-meetup.md

**To Reproduce**
```python
import numpy as np
from sktime.forecasting.exp_smoothing import ExponentialSmoothing
from sktime.forecasting.naive import NaiveForecaster
from sktime.forecasting.model_evaluation import evaluate
from sktime.forecasting.model_selection import SlidingWindowSplitter
from sktime.utils.plotting import plot_series

# fails with: TypeError: No valid mtype could be identified
y = np.random.normal(size=20)
forecaster = ExponentialSmoothing()
forecaster.fit(y)

# works but predict returns np.ndarray
y = np.random.normal(size=(20, 1))
forecaster = NaiveForecaster()
forecaster.fit(y)
y_pred = forecaster.predict(fh=1)
type(y_pred)
#Â numpy.ndarray

# but then other functionality breaks
# fails with TypeError
plot_series(y_pred)

# fails with TypeError: No valid mtype could be identified
y = np.random.normal(size=20)
forecaster = NaiveForecaster()
forecaster.fit(y)

# fails with ValueError: Data must be 1-dimensional
y = np.random.normal(size=(20, 1))
forecaster = ExponentialSmoothing()
forecaster.fit(y)

# fails with ValueError: Index data must be 1-dimensional
y = np.random.normal(size=(20, 1))
forecaster = NaiveForecaster()
cv = SlidingWindowSplitter(fh=1)
evaluate(forecaster, cv, y)
```

**Expected behavior**
Consistent handling of numpy arrays. User-friendly error messages. Preferably also consistent output types.
